io.requery.sql

Interface FieldType<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseType, BigIntType, BinaryType, BlobType, BooleanType, ClobType, DateType, DecimalType, DelegateType, FloatType, IntegerType, JavaDateType, NVarCharType, RealType, SmallIntType, TimeStampType, TimeType, TinyIntType, VarBinaryType, VarCharType

    public interface FieldType<T>
    Represents a stored SQL type which can be read from a JDBC ResultSet and written to a JDBC PreparedStatement.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Integer defaultLength() 
      boolean hasLength() 
      Object identifier() 
      String identifierSuffix() 
      T read(ResultSet results, int column)
      Read the type from a JDBC ResultSet.
      int sqlType() 
      void write(PreparedStatement statement, int index, T value)
      Write the value into a JDBC PreparedStatement.

    • Method Detail

      • read

        T read(ResultSet results,
       int column)
throws SQLException
        Read the type from a JDBC ResultSet.
        Parameters:
        results - result set
        column - column index
        Returns:
        the read value
        Throws:
        SQLException - when failing to read a value from the results

      • write

        void write(PreparedStatement statement,
           int index,
           T value)
    throws SQLException
        Write the value into a JDBC PreparedStatement.
        Parameters:
        statement - statement to use
        index - parameter index
        value - object value
        Throws:
        SQLException - when failing to set the value in the statement

      • sqlType

        int sqlType()
        Returns:
        One of the Types constants indicating the JDBC type

      • hasLength

        boolean hasLength()
        Returns:
        true if this data type has a length constraint, false otherwise.

      • defaultLength

        Integer defaultLength()
        Returns:
        the default length for the type (optional), null if not present.

      • identifier

        Object identifier()
        Returns:
        the identifier for the type can be String or Keyword

      • identifierSuffix

        String identifierSuffix()
        Returns:
        the identifier suffix appears after the identifier and any length size e.g. id(255) suffix
